title: Marchesi Antinori 2012 Badia a Passignano Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned berries, scorched earth, exotic spices, menthol and a whiff of oak are just some of the scents you'll find in this vibrant red. The elegant palate delivers mature Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, orange zest, star anise and a hint of espresso alongside polished, fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2024.

title: Merry Edwards 2015 Meredith Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Soft, velvety, lush and broad, this is a full-figured, darkly brooding wine, steeped in concentrated flavors of strawberry and blackberry. Baked bread, milk chocolate and rose petals accent it well, with supportive, measured oak adding a touch of toast.

title: Mike and Molly Hendry 2015 R.W. Moore Vineyard Zinfandel (Coombsville)
description: From a historic site planted in 1905, this impressive wine is defined by well-crafted layers of black pepper, tomato leaf and blackberry. Its sizable length and breadth is laced in cinnamon spice and ample acidity that reins it in from becoming overdone.

title: Miraflores 2013 Tempranillo (El Dorado)
description: A super dark color and oodles of dark fruit in both the aroma and the flavor make this a rich and seductive wine. It packs in notes of black cherry, blackberry jam and dark chocolate without obvious oakiness even though winemaker Marco Cappelli aged it 20 months in 50% new oak. The wine has good firm structure from lots of soft tannins, full body and moderate acidity making it very impressive, concentrated and layered.

title: Netzl 2015 Edles Tal Red (Carnuntum)
description: Just a whiff of black currant accompanies the dark berry fruit and cocoa spice on the nose. The palate adds a touch of tar to these aromas while firm tannins dry the sides of the mouth. The fruit is concentrated but brightened by ample freshness. A dense, punchy wine in an international style. This will mellow with bottle age. Drink 2019–2028.

title: Nittnaus Anita und Hans 2015 Comondor Red (Burgenland)
description: This is still closed and needs both swirling and swishing to awake. Once it opens up a taut, structured red appears with dense, firm but fine tannins corsetting ripe black cherry and blueberry fruit. There is midpalate weight countered by freshness and glimpses of cinnamon and pepper spice. This has impact but is not heavy, it is concentrated but finely woven. Its lovely balance will benefit from bottle age. Drink 2022–2030.

title: Patz & Hall 2015 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Salted caramel oak is met by pineapple upside down cake in this rich, rewarding and crazily complex white from a well-farmed site. Focused acidity keeps the more voluptuous aspects at bay, settling them into refreshing layers of texture and vibrancy.

title: Rasi 2016 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Big and ripe black fruit is bolstered by sweet thyme, bay leaf and mint on the nose of this powerful bottling by Rachel Silkowski. The wine lands with power and aplomb on the palate, blending star anise, nutmeg and licorice flavors with tangy black plum fruit and a strong acidity to carry it all.

title: Renwood 2014 Tempranillo (Amador County)
description: A generous influence from new oak barrels works beautifully on this full-bodied spice-saturated and richly concentrated wine. It has everything from subtle cinnamon and cardamom to ripe and lush black cherry notes to a lingering finish that echoes spices and dark fruit. Fine-grained tannins shape the mouthfeel and add welcome grip.

title: Scar of the Sea 2015 Seven Leagues Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Sea salt, mandarin zest, fresh white spring flowers and lemon balm make for a very appealing and fragrant nose on this vineyard blend by Mikey Giugni and Michael Brughelli. The palate is zesty, fresh and savory, with flavors of salted apple slices, preserved lemons, toast and a hint of roasted wood.

title: Shafer 2014 Relentless Syrah-Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: This perennial powerhouse of a wine is a blend of 89% Syrah and 11% Petite Sirah, aged 30 months in 100% new French oak. It offers a hard-hitting intensity of stewed plum, cherry and buttery vanilla, with thick, structured tannins that are firm and integrated. Meat, black licorice and black pepper combine effortlessly and should shine bright after aging. Enjoy from 2029 and beyond.

title: Sixto 2014 Moxee Chardonnay (Washington)
description: Coming from a vineyard planted in 1973 at an elevation of 1,450 feet, the aromas draw you into the glass, with intoxicating notes of cream, ginger, pumpkin spice and chamomile. The palate possesses a creamy texture but also a sense of weightlessness that provides a lot of appeal. The balance is exquisite.

title: Steininger 2016 Steinhaus Reserve Riesling (Kamptal)
description: Aromatic clouds of citrus foliage, green apple and fresh lemon waft from the glass. The palate is defined by lemon and tart apple flavors but also riper notions of yellow plum. This is fruity, fresh and light on its feet, with a dry, pure and lasting finish.

title: Stolo 2015 Hillside Reserve Syrah (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Though a bit lighter than in years past due to the tough vintage, this wine is still gamy and feral as usual, with aromas of creosote, roasted lamb and rosemary layered atop a soft red-currant base. It's light in texture, with bright raspberry compote flavors as well as pine oil and juniper.

title: Storm 2015 Vrede Chardonnay (Hemel en Aarde)
description: This Chardonnay shows great concentration and intensity, yet also poise and elegance. Fruity scents of yellow apple and lemon custard are laced with spicy hits of toasted brioche and pie crust. The palate is rich and smooth in texture, but not overdone, thanks to ample acidity and a streak of orange oil that keeps the ripe flavors in check. It's well-balanced and incredibly harmonious, with a long, evolving finish. Drink now–2022.

title: Tegernseerhof 2016 Ried Loibenberg Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)
description: A funky, earthy touch of freshly peeled russet pear hovers on the nose of this wine. A slight lemon oil note shines through. The palate has pure, ripe citrus notes of lemon and tangerine and a pleasantly bitter, pithy backdrop that lends texture and structure. The finish is reminiscent of pure lemon. Drink 2018–2028.

title: Tinhof 2015 Blaufränkisch (Leithaberg)
description: The nose is till closed but gives a touch of tart red cherry and a hint of game. With some air a floral overtone appears. The palate is gently extracted, unforced and presents beautifully pure notes of tart, red cherry. This has a translucent, pure quality and superfine, graceful tannins. Bright acidity lends finesse. There is nothing heavy or heavy-handed about this. How wonderful. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Ventisquero 2013 Pangea Apalta Syrah (Colchagua Valley)
description: This mile-deep Syrah opens with spicy berry, black currant and graphite aromas that blare quality and intensity. Purity of fruit is way up the ladder, with touches of cherry, plum, cassis and blackberry all exuding ripeness. Only on a stout finish does this show oak via a chocolate flavor. Drink through 2024.

title: Wohlmuth 2013 Edelschuh Chardonnay (Südsteiermark)
description: This wine's preserved, salted lemon zest notes rise from the glass. The palate comes in with rich, creamy texture that fleshes out the citrus freshness. A hint of nutty smoke completes the picture. Green and yellow apple notes shimmer before concluding in a dry, creamy, lemony finish.

title: Avennia 2015 Arnaut Boushey Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)
description: Coming from one of the state's premier Syrah vineyards, brooding aromas of dried herb, iron, earth and boysenberry lead to a densely saturated palate. There's no doubt it comes from a warm vintage but it still shows pleasing complexities that reveal themselves over time.

title: Barale Fratelli 2013 Castellero  (Barolo)
description: Made with organically cultivated grapes and fermented with wild yeasts, this boasts alluring scents of rose, perfumed berry, dried herb and dark culinary spice. Youthfully austere but loaded with finesse, the firm palate delivers red cherry, cranberry, pipe tobacco and licorice set against a backbone of vibrant acidity and taut, refined tannins. Give it time to fully blossom. Drink 2023–2043.

title: Domaine Baron de l'Ecluse 2016 Les Garances  (Côte de Brouilly)
description: This is a seriously structured single-vineyard wine. Rich tannins and black-cherry fruit are broadened by wood aging and concentrated toast and spice flavors. The wine is still young and needs to age. Drink from 2019.

title: Brotte 2015 Domaine Barville Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Restrained but ripe, this elegant wine offers concentrated black-cherry and plum flavors shaded in tones of granite, licorice and dried herb. It's rich and expansive on the palate, with a warm, comforting heft. Fresh acidity and fine-grained tannins frame a long finish. It's lovely now but likely to show best from 2020.

title: Trapl 2015 Reserve Blaufränkisch (Carnuntum)
description: Smoke, roast chestnut and plum make for an inviting, rich nose. The palate tones this down with bright acidity and fresher fruit. With more air an alluring overtone of elderberry appears. Aromatics shimmer on the svelte but full-flavored palate and leave an impression of effortless elegance. Lightness is a real virtue here. Drink 2018–2028.

title: Trapl 2016 Ried Gaisberg Weissburgunder (Carnuntum)
description: A touch of smoke, a hint of bruised apple and buttery richness: all of these aromas hint at a complex wine. Yeasty, leesy texture is in the foreground here, rather than fruit. But lemon freshness pervades that salty, moreish creaminess. A dry, sophisticated Pinot Blanc for those who appreciate subtlety and nuance.

title: Cafaggio 2013 Basilica Solatio Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Alluring aromas of wild berry, fragrant purple flower, new leather, dark culinary spice and chopped herb emerge on this classically crafted red. The vibrant, youthfully austere palate offers ripe red cherry, cranberry, tobacco and clove framed in bright acidity and firm, refined tannins. Drink 2019–2028.

title: Domaine des Terres Dorées 2016  Fleurie
description: Made in a rich style, this wine is fully structured and full of black fruit flavors. Grapes from a densely planted old-vine vineyard have added concentration. Drink from late 2018.

title: Château de Saint-Cosme 2014  Gigondas
description: Lavish and ripe, this full-figured red offers loads of plump black-cherry and raspberry flavors. It's surprisingly vibrant on the midpalate, framed by fine, delicate tannins and a bracing hint of charcoal on the finish. Lovely already, it's concentrated enough to improve through 2025.

title: Artner 2016 Ried Steinäcker Zweigelt (Carnuntum)
description: Shy aromas of wet stone and black cherry mark the nose. The palate shows a levity of juicy fruit, yet also a deep well of black cherry richness that needs opening up amidst the shyness and gentle gauze of fine tannins. The long finish seems to promise further development. A lovely, well-judged and rather elegant wine. Drink now–2028.

title: B. Leighton 2014 Olsen Brothers Petit Verdot (Yakima Valley)
description: This variety is making waves in Washington and this wine demonstrates why. The aromas are effusive, with notes of dark cherry, dried herb and barrel spice. The palate is filled to the brim with rich fruit flavors that show focus and depth, while the tannins are combed to a fine sheen. It's high on the hedonist scale—a standout offering.
